        CVV code of the credit card. Chosen to be a string due to regular expression in method.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CreditCard

        public CreditCard()
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Constructor of the CreditCard object. Printing out information for the customer and asking for the customer's input of all payment details.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

        Returns:
        String creditCardCvv

      • inputCCNumber

        private java.lang.String inputCCNumber()
        Method prompting the user to input his/her credit card number. The customer can exit the payment by typing "exit". The do-while loop will run until the customer inserts an existing/valid credit card number.
        Returns:
        String creditCardNumber

      • checkCardNumber

        private static java.lang.Boolean checkCardNumber(java.lang.String cardNumber)
        This method checks the validity of the credit card number according to the Luhn's algorithm. The System only checks for valid Master cards (starting 51-55) and Visa cards (starting with 4). The number itself is checked against the "Luhn's algorithm". (----)
        Parameters:
        cardNumber -
        Returns:
        boolean validNumber, validVisaorMaster

      • inputExpiryDate

        private java.lang.String inputExpiryDate()
        This Method prompts the customer to input the expiry date of the used credit card. Based on a regular expression, the customer can only input 2 digits a / and then 4 digits.
        Returns:
        String expiryDate

      • inputCVVCode

        private java.lang.String inputCVVCode()
        This Method prompts the customer to input the CVV Code of his/her credit card. The input must compose of three digits.
        Returns:
        String cvvCode

      • makePayment

        public void makePayment()
                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method pretends to make a payment by printing out 15 = signs in a row (for-loop). The tread.sleep method allows to freeze the execution for a designated time (80 milliseconds in this case).
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
